description.narrative: In 2019, schools, local authorities and communities most vulnerable to conflict and the Ministry of Education will be better prepared to provide education services in a safe, relevant and appropriate way to all children, teenagers and teachers living in or returning to these communities,which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, girls, boys and adolescents including those from conflict affected areas access and stay in an equitable, inclusive and quality education system that contributes to a sustainable peace and reconciliation process

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities disaster prevention and preparedness

title.narrative: Colombia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Colombia: Evaluación de resultados de las acciones de inclusión de familias con niñas niños y adolescentes con discapacidad en Familias en Acción (2012-2018)
Colombia 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Colombia 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Colombia 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: In 2019, schools, local authorities and communities most vulnerable to conflict and the Ministry of Education will be better prepared to provide education services in a safe, relevant and appropriate way to all children, teenagers and teachers living in or returning to these communities

description.narrative: UNICEF Colombia provided a tailored-made education response to the complex humanitarian situation in the country. This considers: 1. Strengthening the education system at a national level (including the coordination of the education in emergencies cluster, conducting education needs assessment and specific information to assist decision making processes at political level) and 2. Providing direct education services (formal and non-formal) to enhance children's development in a crisis context. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2020

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Emergency response - Number of districts affected by civil strife, conflict, natural disaster or another emergency that have clear strategies for ensuring children's right to education
Number of schools implementing safe school protocols (COVID-19 prevention and control) [COVIDSitRep]
Number of children supported with distance/home-based learning [COVIDSitRep]

Percentage of certified territorial entities in areas targeted by UNICEF and affected by conflict that implement strategies in accordance with MEN guidelines to ensure protective environments for children and teenagers.

baseline.value: 1 (Putumayo) implements appropriate strategies to ensure protective environments for children and teenagers.

target.value: 2019:At least 80 % of certified territorial entities in areas targeted by UNICEF

title.narrative: Number of rural and boarding schools in areas affected by the conflict or humanitarian situations that implement strategies in accordance with MEN guidelines to ensure protective environments for children and teenagers

baseline.value: 12 boarding schools in Putumayo have taken action to strengthen the protective environment.475 schools have school risk management plans in place.

target.value: 2019:12 additional boarding schools in priority municipalities implement appropriate strategies to ensure protective environments for children and teenagers.840 schools have school risk management plans in

actual.value: 2019:767 numer of schools increased in 2019 in 76 rural schools in conflict affected areas

title.narrative: Percentage of educational institutions targeted by UNICEF that implement school risk management plans to ensure protective environments at school.

baseline.value: 400 EIs have designed school risk management plans to ensure protective environments at school.

target.value: 2019:At least 50 % of targeted EI implement school risk management plans to ensure protective environments at school.
